txt.en: You have awoken the bog-lurkers and aided Quickbeam's Huorn.
DNT -- Players will not see
DNT -- Player will not see
Defend the sleeping bog-lurker
Wake Treebeard's bog-lurker
Wake Quickbeam's bog-lurker
Search for Skinbark's bog-lurker
As you approach Quickbeam's bog-lurker, its reeds shake and it looks up at you from the ground.\n\nSeeing Quickbeam's Huorn beside you, it rises to its feet and readies itself to aid the forest.
<rgb=#FF0000>Pat</rgb> Beechbone's bog-lurker to wake it
The bog-lurker continues to slumber, but in the distance you hear the breaking of twigs and rapid beats of wings.\n\nYou must defend the lurker until it can be roused!
DNT
Completed
Treebeard's bog-lurker scrambles to its feet and looks about the surrounding area
As he awakes, Quickbeam's bog-lurker seems to recognize the scent of his Ent-friend on you
DNT -- Players will not see
Having rested through much turmoil, Skinbark's bog-lurker rises and surveys the forest
You have awoken the bog-lurkers and aided Quickbeam and the Huorn. Perhaps these bog-lurkers can aid in quelling the wild behaviour of their brethren.

As you approach the river Entwash, Quickbeam's Huorn seems distressed by the wild bog-lurkers nearby. \n\nThe Huorn begins to wander, seemingly hoping to find bog-lurkers that haven't awoken in the darkness of Fangorn.
Awaking the Forest
While initially concerned at your closeness, the bog-lurker stands and readies itself to aid Quickbeam
Without the Ents to guide them, the bog-lurkers of Fangorn have grown wild and dangerous save for a few still loyal to the Ents.
Bog-lurkers can be found along the Entwash in Fangorn Forest.\n\nThe Huorn would appreciate your aid in gathering the bog-lurkers that have not gone wild in the absence of the Ents.
